meanings.definition: To confine or segregate a group of people in a specific area, typically based on socioeconomic status or ethnicity.
meanings.sent1: The government was ghettoing certain neighborhoods, separating them from the rest of the city.
meanings.sent2: The city council decided to stop ghettoing people based on their income levels.
meanings.sent3: The idea of ghettoing people because of their skin color is outdated and unfair.
meanings.sent4: In a way, by ghettoing certain groups, society is creating invisible barriers.
meanings.sent5: The impact of ghettoing communities can be devastating and long-lasting.

meanings.definition: The act of creating or forming a ghetto.
meanings.sent1: The ghettoing of the neighborhood led to increased crime rates.
meanings.sent2: Historically, ghettoing was a common practice in many cities.
meanings.sent3: The children played a game pretending they were ghettoing their toys into separate areas.
meanings.sent4: The artist used colors to represent the process of ghettoing in his painting.
meanings.sent5: The documentary shed light on the harsh reality of ghettoing in urban areas.

meanings.definition: The process of isolating or marginalizing a particular group within a community.
meanings.sent1: The ghettoing of the minority population caused tension within the city.
meanings.sent2: Ghettoing can lead to feelings of exclusion and discrimination.
meanings.sent3: The school project aimed to raise awareness about the negative effects of ghettoing.
meanings.sent4: The media often portrays the process of ghettoing in a negative light.
meanings.sent5: The community worked together to prevent the ghettoing of vulnerable groups.
